DataElement.preferredName: Derived Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status Metastatic Assessment Age Day Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value to represent the age of the individual on the occurrence of ECOG performance status assessment after a metastatic diagnosis, represented as a calculated age in days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status Metastatic Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up._A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities._A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) was established in 1955. This is a cooperative group (Philadelphia, PA) funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.
A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.
